item.title: Tesla Cybertruck fails to boost 2024 sales as annual deliveries fall for first time
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
Tesla delivered fewer cars last year than it did in 2023, marking its first year-to-year drop and signaling that the company is struggling to reach new buyers. That means Tesla’s Cybertruck, which is the company’s first true new model since 2020, did little to boost the company’s growth in its first full year of sales. […]

item.title: Apheris rethinks the AI data bottleneck in life science with federated computing
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
AI is fundamentally dependent on data, but the vast majority of health data goes unused for understandable reasons — chiefly patient privacy, regulation and IP protection. “This is the core underlying problem” of building AI solutions for life sciences and related areas like pharmaceutics, said German entrepreneur Robin Röhm. And not only that: collaboration when […]

item.title: 2025 will be the year climate tech learns to love AI
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description:
As 2025 dawns, it’s a good time to look at the trends that are likely to define the coming 12 months.

item.title: Telegram rolls out third-party account verification, filters
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
Telegram has rolled out its first update of the year, adding a new account verification method powered by third-parties, new message search filters, and the ability to turn gifts into NFTs. The chat app already had a program to verify public figures and organizations on the platform, and it has now launched a new project […]

item.title: Chinese government hackers reportedly targeted US Treasury’s sanctions office during December cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Carly Page
item.description:
Chinese government hackers targeted the U.S. Treasury’s highly sensitive sanctions office during a December cyberattack, according to reports. According to The Washington Post, the state-sponsored hackers targeted the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), a government department that imposes economic and trade sanctions against countries and individuals, to potentially access information on Chinese organizations that […]

item.title: Cybertruck explosion outside Trump hotel in Vegas leaves 1 dead, 7 injured
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
A Tesla Cybertruck that exploded and burst into flames Wednesday morning just outside the Trump International Hotel Las Vegas has left one person dead and several injured, according to the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department. Seven people suffered minor injuries, Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department Sheriff Kevin McMahill said during a media briefing Wednesday. McMahill […]

item.title: Toyota’s CES 2025 press conference: How to watch
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description:
Five years ago, Toyota Chairman Akio Toyoda went to CES to share with the world his “personal field of dreams” — a plan to build a prototype city on a 175-acre site at the foot of Mount Fuji in Japan, where people would live and work amongst all of Toyota’s projects, including autonomous vehicle technology, […]

item.title: People are playing a new DOOM-themed CAPTCHA
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
CAPTCHA programs that are used to determine whether a site visitor is a person or a bot come in pretty standard formats. Think text distortion (where users type the characters they see in a box amid other squiggles); image recognition (you’re selecting, say, all the squares in a grid with a bicycle image); and checkbox […]

item.title: Internal SpaceX documents show the sweet stock deals offered to investors like a16z, Gigafund
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort, Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description:
Like many highly valued startups, SpaceX sometimes allows its employees to cash out some of their shares by selling to company-authorized outside investors. TechCrunch has gotten a peek at an internal SpaceX document about such a tender offer from May 2022. Musk posted on X last month that SpaceX holds such sales for employees about […]

item.title: Robinhood, already a ‘comeback’ stock, has even more aggressive plans for 2025
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description:
Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev has a lot to celebrate this holiday season. After a bumpy few years following Robinhood’s 2021 IPO — a period during which shares of the commission-free trading app plummeted by more than 90% after it abruptly restricted trading in some meme stocks —  the 12-year-old company was just declared Yahoo Finance’s […]

item.title: OpenAI failed to deliver the opt-out tool it promised by 2025
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Back in May, OpenAI said it was developing a tool to let creators specify how they want their works to be included in — or excluded from — its AI training data. But 7 months later, this feature has yet to see the light of day. Called Media Manager, the tool would “identify copyrighted text, […]

item.title: Silicon Valley stifled the AI doom movement in 2024
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
For several years now, technologists have rung alarm bells about the potential for advanced AI systems to cause catastrophic damage to the human race. But in 2024, those warning calls were drowned out by a practical and prosperous vision of generative AI promoted by the tech industry – a vision that also benefited their wallets. […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Accel closes $650 million for new India fund
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
Accel has raised $650 million for its eighth India fund as the U.S. venture firm expands its investment strategy in the South Asian market. The new fund follows the firm’s seventh India fund secured in March 2022. Accel — which has backed companies including e-commerce group Flipkart, food delivery platform Swiggy, and software group Freshworks […]

item.title: Judge allows California’s ban on addictive feeds for minors to go into effect
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Late Tuesday evening, a federal judge blocked tech lobbying group NetChoice’s challenge to California’s recently enacted law, SB 976, which prohibits companies from serving “addictive feeds” to minors. The effect of this decision is that beginning Wednesday, companies will be prohibited from serving an addictive feed to a California-based user they know to be a […]

item.title: Elon Musk’s pro-Trump critics claim they’re being censored on X
item.dc:creator: Charles Rollet
item.description:
Conservative activists claim X is censoring them for being critical of its owner, Elon Musk.

item.title: Will Smith eating spaghetti and other weird AI benchmarks that took off in 2024
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
When a company releases a new AI video generator, it’s not long before someone uses it to make a video of actor Will Smith eating spaghetti. It’s become something of a meme as well as a benchmark: Seeing whether a new video generator can realistically render Smith slurping down a bowl of noodles. Smith himself […]

item.title: A look back on my favorite episodes of TechCrunch’s Found podcast
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
TechCrunch’s Found podcast, which has brought listeners the stories behind the startups since April 2022, released its final episode today. I’ve been one of the hosts of Found since November 2022 and in that time have spoken to more than 75 founders about the startups they are building. These founders hail from many different backgrounds […]

item.title: Investigation exposes pedophilia in the child-influencer industry

item.description:
A New York Times investigation found that dozens of potential pedophiles have prolifically exploited the child influencer industry.

item.title: Elon Musk’s promises for Tesla in 2024, from robotaxis to Optimus bots
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
Elon Musk had an eventful 2024, what with his hard push into right-wing politics and leveraging his X social media platform and considerable influence to help Donald Trump win the presidential election. Putting politics aside for a moment, it’s worth focusing on another Musk pastime: making promises for Tesla. The Tesla CEO’s promises — and […]

item.title: A Waymo robotaxi and a Serve delivery robot collided in Los Angeles
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description:
On December 27, a Waymo robotaxi and a Serve Robotics sidewalk delivery robot collided at a Los Angeles intersection, according to a video that’s circulating on social media. The footage shows a Serve bot crossing a street in West Hollywood at night and trying to get onto the sidewalk. It reached the curb, backed up […]
